attributes.action: sanction a full, independent, public inquiry into the deaths at Deepcut army barracks between 1995 and 2002.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: No satisfactory answers have yet been provided to account for the deaths of Pte Sean Benton, Pte Cheryl James, Pte Geoff Gray and Pte James Collinson at Deepcut barracks. The government has been happy to agree to any form of action in this case - other than the one demanded from the very beginning. The circumstances of the deaths and the appalling handling of the case by the authorities cries out for thorough, transparent and independent investigation. The only way forward is a public inquiry.

rejection.details: Individual legal cases are a matter for direct communication with the Home Office.
reasons: The names of individuals, or information where they may be identified, in relation to criminal accusations
